titleStmt.title: J. W. Miller et al. to Thomas E. Bramlette
CWG4438

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p: To His Excelency That Governor of Kentucky

Your pettioners would represent represent That at the Last Term of the galitin circuit court That Vincent Ross was Fined the sum of Thirty-nine 55/100 for playing Cards in That county The facts of the case are These Said Ross was at a Sale in galitin county while There Some of Ross friends was playing at a gam for pastime he Ross Set down and played a few games for which he was fined endited & Summons to appear at court which he fully intended to do but forgot the day of trial living in another county the other parties appeared & got cleard but Ross not appearing was fined $20000 + 1955/100 ^cost^ and an execution was isued & sent to Boone county for collection which is in the hands of The DS J. O. Miller for collection we the petitioners would ask your exelency to remit the fine except attonys fee & cost this Nov 28th 1863.

Names
J. W. Miller
John Hamilton
D. C. Glore
C. B. Johnson
R R Grimsley
J. C. Miller
Samuel Woldford
J. Miller
John M Migntyn
Names
B B Allffrin
J. B Johnson
G L Miller
Geo W Black
J. T. Black
G. W. Baker
G G Miller Justice of peace

Gallatin Cir Court
vs
Vincent Ross
$20 --
Gaming
th Apl/ 64

Remit except fees & costs
Tho E Bramlette
